value.0: "I hear you've been very busy. Not that I'm concerned, but I do grow weary listening to people talk about you."
"And what exactly do you want? I hope you do not expect me to treat you as a serious threat." With an arrogant sneer, your opponent, Sir Becket, eyes you up and down.
"Parting is the only enjoyable moment of this entire conversation."
"Well, why not? Why don't I take you on a personal tour of the keep? I can buy you some little souvenirs and then you can be on your way to some other delightful vacation spot."

LinkComment.value: if PC overheard Sir Becket and maid
if PC was attacked and found note on assassin

value.0: "Wait, I have a better idea. Why don't you just go away? That would solve many of my problems."
His eyes flick over the paper and tighten with anger. "So what is this to me?"
"You cannot prove that was me. There must be a lot of people who would want you dead."

LinkComment.value: if PC overheard Sir Becket and maid

value.0: "It is already forgotten."
"What were you doing in my... damn it! Decent guards are so hard to find these days."
"There must be some kind of deal we can work out? Everyone needs something, what is it that you need?"
"Do not turn away this opportunity, <FirstName>. What if I was to offer you my votes and 500 gold? I wouldn't mind giving up the Lordship, if I were the Banner, perhaps."
"Then do your worst, but know that you have made a terrible enemy today. Someday you shall pay for your temerity!"

value.0: "That seems... fair enough. I took a gamble and lost, I guess now I must pay for it. Here, take this amulet. Now, if you leave me alone, I will leave you alone."

Comment.value: mark SB not speaking to PC, give PC 1000 gold and some xp

value.0: "That seems... fair enough. I took a gamble and lost, I guess now I must pay for it. Here, take this gold. Now, if you leave me alone, I will leave you alone."
"Never speak to me again."
"I could do that. I wouldn't even mind doing that, if I could be your Banner. I would even assist you, say, with 500 gold. What do you think?"
"Then I shall give you nothing! Somehow I will regain my votes and I will defeat you! A word of caution... on the day I win this election you had best leave town."
"You... you shall pay for this affront! Never speak to me again, fool!"

value.0: "Oh, how original. I am surprised it didn't take a genius like you a whole day to come up with that response. I don't think I'll ever be speaking to you again."
"They should, fool. Never speak to me again."
"You have to ask that? You really are stupid. Never speak to me again, fool."

value.0: "Those are the words I like to hear. When the election comes, all of my votes are yours... just do not break your word to me. Here is your 500 gold."
"I will go and speak to my associates and make sure they are voting for you now. Best of luck, <FirstName>."
"My fate might not be looking so good, but there is no promise that Enivid cannot beat you. I am good at looking at a situation and seeing the realities of it."
"A Banner must be able to make difficult decisions, read people, make them work together; I can do these things!"
"I promise I would make a good and loyal Banner. Is that such a high price to gain my support?"
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "There is no evidence. Not enough to make people believe you over me, anyways."
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "You... you do? No, fine, fine, I believe you!"
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "She couldn't prove it either. She's even more foolish than you."
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "She would love to find some way to discredit me, wouldn't she?"
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "You don't frighten me! If you kill me, everyone will know it was you and you'll lose the election to Enivid."
"I think this conversation has gone far enough. Good day to you!"
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Sir Becket's eyes get large and he glances around nervously. "No, I think here would be fine."

value.0: "Such rumors have been leveled at me before. People are just jealous of the strength of our love for one another. Ellysia shall not fall for your idle gossip. Now, enough about this."

"I do not suffer fools lightly. I have a large amount of wealth, just tell me what I must do!"
